supporting_text: The NAP represents the sector-specific operational deployment in human health of the 2016 'One Health' interministerial roadmap for controlling antibiotic resistance, which links human, animal and ecosystem health.
The NAP mentions specific actions in the human health sector, including measures for infection prevention and control and antibiotic stewardship.
The 2022-2025 National Strategy for Preventing Infections and Antibiotic Resistance only relates to human health.
The NAP includes measures aimed at developing a sense of 'environmental preservation' in infection and antibiotic resistance prevention measures.
The NAP does not explicitly mention strategies or actions targeting agriculture or food security.
An annual report on the implemented measures will be published by the MSS, including the monitoring and impact indicators included in this document.
The NAP sets ambitious targets for 2025, such as reducing the use of antibiotics in community care across France by 25% compared to 2019.
The NAP includes specific targets for reducing antibiotic prescriptions and monitoring antibiotic resistance data.
The NAP does not specify budget allocations for the strategies or actions.
The NAP does not contain an assessment of future budget requirements.
The NAP mentions a national steering committee for preventing infections and antibiotic resistance, which includes various stakeholders.
The NAP does not explicitly mention strengthening the legislative and regulatory framework for AMR.
The NAP includes measures to improve education on the prevention of infections and antibiotic resistance from an early age.
The NAP includes implementing a national and regional health promotion campaign focusing on antibiotic stewardship and the consequences of antibiotic resistance.
The NAP mentions contributing to France's international influence and visibility in the fight against antibiotic resistance.
The NAP includes measures for improving national coverage of antibiotic resistance data collection.
The NAP does not specifically mention developing capacity for detecting and reporting newly emerged resistance.
The NAP emphasizes the importance of infection prevention and control measures, including hygiene practices.
The NAP does not explicitly mention implementing international standards and guidelines for AMR control.
The NAP does not specify actions related to regulating the distribution or prescription of antibiotics.
The NAP does not mention regulations or laws requiring the rational use of antibiotics.
The NAP encourages cross-cutting, collaborative and interdisciplinary research in the field of preventing infections and antibiotic resistance.
